comments.body: My understanding was that @bame-da and you agreed to not have a default once 1.11 is stable and force users to choose. Is that still the plan? Perfectly fine not to include it in this PR.
I did not understand that. Let's sync with @bame-da and implement a fix (if necessary) in another PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +415,419 @@      if (config.seeding.isEmpty) {
        logger.withoutContext.warn(
          s"""|'${Seeding.NoSeedingModeName}' contract IDs seeding mode is not compatible with the LF 1.11 languages or later.
              |A ledger stared with ${Seeding.NoSeedingModeName} contract IDs seeding will refuse to load LF 1.11 language or later. 
              |To make sure you can load LF 1.11, use the option '--contract-id-seeding=strong' to set up the contract IDs seeding mode.""".stripMargin

comments.body: @remyhaemmerle-da: We must make sure to rephrase this once 1.11 is actually released, or phrase it differently now.

As described in the `TODO`, just above I will rephrase it once 1.11 is actually released. 
(I will grep for "TODO https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/issues/7139"before closing #7139 )

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +417,421 @@        //  rephrase the message once LF 1.11 is released
        logger.withoutContext.warn(
          s"""|'${Seeding.NoSeedingModeName}' contract IDs seeding mode is not compatible with the LF 1.11 languages or later which will be released soon.
              |A ledger stared with ${Seeding.NoSeedingModeName} contract IDs seeding will refuse to load LF 1.11 language or later. 
              |To make sure you can load LF 1.11 in future releases, use the option '--contract-id-seeding=strong' to set up the contract IDs seeding mode.""".stripMargin

comments.body: Is the "if" clause intended in this place
Yes. Since LF 1.dev is not designed to works with legacy Contract ID, I think it is safer to not start the sandbox at all in this case. But if you prefer dropping the condition, it is fine with me.
No that's fine. We have a catch-all clause further down. I just wanted to make sure it is intended.
